mode.title: OST (OCR) Rejimi
mode.text: Optical Character Recognition (OCR) helps you turn scanned or screenshotted pages into text you can search, copy, or highlight.
mode.bullet1: Auto skips pages that already contain text layers.
mode.bullet2: Force re-OCRs every page and replaces all the text.
mode.bullet3: Strict halts if any selectable text is found.

languages.title: Dillər
languages.text: Improve OCR accuracy by specifying the expected languages. Choose one or more languages to guide detection.

output.title: Output
output.text: Decide how you want the text output formatted:
output.bullet1: Searchable PDF embeds text behind the original image.
output.bullet2: HOCR XML returns a structured machine-readable file.
output.bullet3: Plain-text sidecar creates a separate .txt file with raw content.

compatibility.title: Compatibility Mode
compatibility.text: Uses OCR 'sandwich PDF' mode: results in larger files, but more reliable with certain languages and older PDF software. By default we use hOCR for smaller, modern PDFs.

sidecar.title: Create Text File
sidecar.text: Generates a separate .txt file alongside the PDF containing all extracted text content for easy access and processing.

deskew.title: Deskew Pages
deskew.text: Automatically corrects skewed or tilted pages to improve OCR accuracy. Useful for scanned documents that weren't perfectly aligned.

clean.title: Clean Input File
clean.text: Preprocesses the input by removing noise, enhancing contrast, and optimising the image for better OCR recognition before processing.

cleanFinal.title: Clean Final Output
cleanFinal.text: Post-processes the final PDF by removing OCR artefacts and optimising the text layer for better readability and smaller file size.

certSign.title: Sertifikatla İmzala

overview.title: How signatures work
overview.text: Both modes seal the document (any edits are flagged as tampering) and record who/when/how for auditing. Viewer trust depends on the certificate chain.

manual.title: Manual - Bring your certificate
manual.text: Use your own certificate files for brand-aligned identity. Can display Trusted when your CA/chain is recognised.

auto.title: Auto - Zero-setup, instant system seal
auto.text: Signs with a server self-signed certificate. Same tamper-evident seal and audit trail; typically shows Unverified in viewers.
auto.use: Use when: you need speed and consistent internal identity across reviews and records.

rule.title: Rule of thumb
rule.text: Need recipient Trusted status? Manual. Need a fast, tamper-evident seal and audit trail with no setup? Auto.

invisible.title: Invisible Signatures
invisible.text: The signature is added to the PDF for security but won't be visible when viewing the document. Perfect for legal requirements without changing the document's appearance.
invisible.bullet2: Meets legal requirements for digital signing
invisible.bullet3: Doesn't affect document layout or design

visible.title: Visible Signatures
visible.text: Shows a signature block on the PDF with your name, date, and optional details. Useful when you want readers to clearly see the document is signed.
visible.bullet1: Shows signer name and date on the document
visible.bullet2: Can include reason and location for signing
visible.bullet3: Choose which page to place the signature

error.failed: An error occurred whilst processing signatures.

overview.title: What can this tool do?
overview.text: This tool lets you check if your PDFs are digitally signed and add new digital signatures. Digital signatures prove who created or approved a document and show if it has been changed since signing.
overview.bullet1: Check existing signatures and their validity
overview.bullet2: View detailed information about signers and certificates
overview.bullet3: Add new digital signatures to secure your documents
overview.bullet4: Multiple files supported with easy navigation

validation.title: Checking Signatures
validation.text: When you check signatures, the tool tells you if they're valid, who signed the document, when it was signed, and whether the document has been changed since signing.
validation.bullet1: Shows if signatures are valid or invalid
validation.bullet2: Displays signer information and signing date
validation.bullet3: Checks if the document was modified after signing
validation.bullet4: Can use custom certificates for verification

signing.title: Adding Signatures
signing.text: To sign a PDF, you need a digital certificate (like PEM, PKCS12, or JKS). You can choose to make the signature visible on the document or keep it invisible for security only.
signing.bullet1: Supports PEM, PKCS12, JKS, and server certificate formats
signing.bullet2: Option to show or hide signature on the PDF
signing.bullet3: Add reason, location, and signer name
signing.bullet4: Choose which page to place visible signatures

what.title: What's a certificate?
what.text: It's a secure ID for your signature that proves you signed. Unless you're required to sign via certificate, we recommend using another secure method like Type, Draw, or Upload.

which.title: Which option should I use?
which.text: Choose the format that matches your certificate file:
which.bullet3: PEM – separate private-key and certificate .pem files
which.bullet4: JKS – Java .jks keystore for dev / CI-CD workflows

convert.title: Key not listed?
convert.text: Convert your file to a Java keystore (.jks) with keytool, then pick JKS.

redact.title: Manual Redaction

error.failed: An error occurred while redacting the PDF.

modeSelector.title: Redaction Method
modeSelector.automaticDesc: Redact text based on search terms
modeSelector.manualDesc: Click and drag to redact specific areas

automatic.title: Automatic Redaction
automatic.text: Automatically finds and redacts specified text throughout the document. Perfect for removing consistent sensitive information like names, addresses, or confidential markers.

manual.title: Manual Redaction
manual.text: Click and drag to manually select specific areas to redact. Gives you precise control over what gets redacted. (Coming soon)

description.title: Text Matching
description.text: Enter words or phrases to find and redact in your document. Each word will be searched for separately.

words.bullet1: Add one word at a time
words.bullet2: Press Enter or click 'Add Another' to add

examples.title: Common Examples
examples.text: Typical words to redact include: bank details, email addresses, or specific names.

color.title: Box Colour & Padding
color.text: Customise the appearance of redaction boxes. Black is standard, but you can choose any colour. Padding adds extra space around the found text.

regex.title: Use Regex
regex.text: Enable regular expressions for advanced pattern matching. Useful for finding phone numbers, emails, or complex patterns.
regex.bullet1: Example: \d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} to match any dates in YYYY-MM-DD format

wholeWord.title: Whole Word Search
wholeWord.text: Only match complete words, not partial matches. 'John' won't match 'Johnson' when enabled.

convert.title: Convert to PDF-Image
convert.text: Converts the PDF to an image-based PDF after redaction. This ensures text behind redaction boxes is completely removed and unrecoverable.

manual.convertPDFToImageLabel: Convert PDF to PDF-Image (Used to remove text behind the box)
manual.showDocumentOutline: Show Document Outline (double-click to expand/collapse all items)
manual.showLayers: Show Layers (double-click to reset all layers to the default state)

redact.convertPDFToImageLabel: Convert PDF to PDF-Image (Used to remove text behind the box)
redact.showDocumentOutline: Show Document Outline (double-click to expand/collapse all items)
redact.showLayers: Show Layers (double-click to reset all layers to the default state)

overlay-pdfs.title: Overlay PDFs
overlay-pdfs.desc: Overlay one PDF on top of another

counts.label: Overlay Sayları (Sabit Təkrar Rejimi üçün)
counts.placeholder: Sayları vergüllə ayrılmış şəkildə daxil edin (məsələn, 2,3,1)
counts.noFiles: Add overlay files to configure counts

description.title: Description
description.text: Combine a base PDF with one or more overlay PDFs. Overlays can be applied page-by-page in different modes and placed in the foreground or background.

mode.title: Overlay Mode
mode.text: Choose how to distribute overlay pages across the base PDF pages.
mode.sequential: Sequential Overlay: Use pages from the first overlay PDF until it ends, then move to the next.
mode.interleaved: Interleaved Overlay: Take one page from each overlay in turn.
mode.fixedRepeat: Fixed Repeat Overlay: Take a set number of pages from each overlay before moving to the next. Use Counts to set the numbers.

position.title: Overlay Position
position.text: Foreground places the overlay on top of the page. Background places it behind.

overlayFiles.title: Overlay Files
overlayFiles.text: Select one or more PDFs to overlay on the base. The order of these files affects how pages are applied in Sequential and Fixed Repeat modes.

counts.title: Counts (Fixed Repeat only)
counts.text: Provide a positive number for each overlay file showing how many pages to take before moving to the next. Required when mode is Fixed Repeat.

error.failed: An error occurred while overlaying PDFs.

description.title: Description
description.text: Transform PDF colours to improve readability and accessibility. Choose from high contrast presets, invert all colours, or create custom colour schemes.

highContrast.title: High Contrast
highContrast.text: Apply predefined high contrast colour combinations designed for better readability and accessibility compliance.
highContrast.bullet1: White text on black background - Classic dark mode
highContrast.bullet2: Black text on white background - Standard high contrast
highContrast.bullet3: Yellow text on black background - High visibility option
highContrast.bullet4: Green text on black background - Alternative high contrast

invertAll.title: Invert All Colours
invertAll.text: Completely invert all colours in the PDF, creating a negative-like effect. Useful for creating dark mode versions of documents or reducing eye strain in low-light conditions.

custom.title: Custom Colours
custom.text: Define your own text and background colours using the colour pickers. Perfect for creating branded documents or specific accessibility requirements.
custom.bullet1: Text colour - Choose the colour for text elements
custom.bullet2: Background colour - Set the background colour for the document

cmyk.title: Convert to CMYK
cmyk.text: Convert the PDF from RGB colour space to CMYK colour space, optimized for professional printing. This process converts colours to the Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black model used by printers.

description.1: We use cookies and other technologies to make Stirling PDF work better for you—helping us improve our tools and keep building features you'll love.
description.2: If you’d rather not, clicking 'No Thanks' will only enable the essential cookies needed to keep things running smoothly.

description.1: Stirling PDF uses cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience and understand how our tools are used. This helps us improve performance, develop the features you care about, and provide ongoing support to our users.
description.2: Stirling PDF cannot—and will never—track or access the content of the documents you use.
description.3: Your privacy and trust are at the core of what we do.

necessary.description: These cookies are essential for the website to function properly. They enable core features like setting your privacy preferences, logging in, and filling out forms—which is why they can’t be turned off.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.description: These cookies help us understand how our tools are being used, so we can focus on building the features our community values most. Rest assured—Stirling PDF cannot and will never track the content of the documents you work with.

general.title: System Settings
general.description: Configure system-wide application settings including branding and default behaviour.

appName.label: Application Name
appName.description: The name displayed in the browser tab and home page

appNameNavbar.label: Navbar Brand
appNameNavbar.description: The name displayed in the navigation bar

homeDescription.label: Home Description
homeDescription.description: The description text shown on the home page

defaultLocale.label: Default Locale
defaultLocale.description: The default language for new users (e.g., en_US, es_ES)

showUpdate.label: Show Update Notifications
showUpdate.description: Display notifications when a new version is available

showUpdateOnlyAdmin.label: Show Updates to Admins Only
showUpdateOnlyAdmin.description: Restrict update notifications to admin users only

customHTMLFiles.label: Custom HTML Files
customHTMLFiles.description: Allow serving custom HTML files from the customFiles directory

author.description: Default author for PDF metadata (e.g., username)

ssoNotice.title: Looking for SSO/SAML settings?

enableLogin.label: Enable Login
enableLogin.description: Require users to log in before accessing the application

loginMethod.label: Login Method
loginMethod.description: The authentication method to use for user login

loginAttemptCount.description: Maximum number of failed login attempts before account lockout

loginResetTimeMinutes.label: Login Reset Time (minutes)
loginResetTimeMinutes.description: Time before failed login attempts are reset

csrfDisabled.label: Disable CSRF Protection

username.label: Initial Username

password.label: Initial Password

retentionDays.label: Audit Retention (days)

passwords.title: Password Types
passwords.text: User passwords restrict opening the document, while owner passwords control what can be done with the document once opened. You can set both or just one.
passwords.bullet1: User Password: Required to open the PDF
passwords.bullet2: Owner Password: Controls document permissions (not supported by all PDF viewers)

encryption.title: Encryption Levels
encryption.text: Higher encryption levels provide better security but may not be supported by older PDF viewers.
encryption.bullet1: 40-bit: Basic security, compatible with older viewers

permissions.title: İcazələri Dəyişdir
permissions.text: These permissions control what users can do with the PDF. Most effective when combined with an owner password.

suggested.securePdfIngestionDesc: Comprehensive PDF processing workflow that sanitises documents, applies OCR with cleanup, converts to PDF/A format for long-term archival, and optimises file size.
suggested.emailPreparationDesc: Optimises PDFs for email distribution by compressing files, splitting large documents into 20MB chunks for email compatibility, and removing metadata for privacy.
suggested.secureWorkflowDesc: Secures PDF documents by removing potentially malicious content like JavaScript and embedded files, then adds password protection to prevent unauthorised access. Password is set to 'password' by default.
suggested.processImagesDesc: Converts multiple image files into a single PDF document, then applies OCR technology to extract searchable text from the images.

welcomeModal.title: Welcome to Stirling PDF!
welcomeModal.description: Would you like to take a quick 1-minute tour to learn the key features and how to get started?
welcomeModal.helpHint: You can always access this tour later from the Help button in the bottom left.

onboarding.allTools: This is the All Tools panel, where you can browse and select from all available PDF tools.
onboarding.selectCropTool: Let's select the Crop tool to demonstrate how to use one of the tools.
onboarding.toolInterface: This is the Crop tool interface. As you can see, there's not much there because we haven't added any PDF files to work with yet.
onboarding.filesButton: The Files button on the Quick Access bar allows you to upload PDFs to use the tools on.
onboarding.fileSources: You can upload new files or access recent files from here. For the tour, we'll just use a sample file.
onboarding.workbench: This is the Workbench - the main area where you view and edit your PDFs.
onboarding.viewSwitcher: Use these controls to select how you want to view your PDFs.
onboarding.viewer: The Viewer lets you read and annotate your PDFs.
onboarding.pageEditor: The Page Editor allows you to do various operations on the pages within your PDFs, such as reordering, rotating and deleting.
onboarding.activeFiles: The Active Files view shows all of the PDFs you have loaded into the tool, and allows you to select which ones to process.
onboarding.fileCheckbox: Clicking one of the files selects it for processing. You can select multiple files for batch operations.
onboarding.selectControls: The Right Rail contains buttons to quickly select/deselect all of your active PDFs, along with buttons to change the app's theme or language.
onboarding.cropSettings: Now that we've selected the file we want crop, we can configure the Crop tool to choose the area that we want to crop the PDF to.
onboarding.runButton: Once the tool has been configured, this button allows you to run the tool on all the selected PDFs.
onboarding.results: After the tool has finished running, the Review step will show a preview of the results in this panel, and allow you to undo the operation or download the file.
onboarding.fileReplacement: The modified file will replace the original file in the Workbench automatically, allowing you to easily run it through more tools.
onboarding.pinButton: You can use the Pin button if you'd rather your files stay active after running tools on them.
onboarding.wrapUp: You're all set! You've learnt about the main areas of the app and how to use them. Click the Help button whenever you like to see this tour again.
onboarding.startTourDescription: Take a guided tour of Stirling PDF's key features
